title.narrative: 02-01 PAEDIATRIC AIDS/PMTCT - HEALTH

description.narrative: 2.1. By 2021, pregnant women living with HIV have access to quality elimination of mother to child transmission of HIV (eMTCT) services and their infants have improved access to early diagnosis, treatment and care ( first decade), which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Hiv â€“ General, Pmtct And Infant Male Circumcision. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By 2021, children, adolescents, and pregnant women use quality, accessible, and proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions.

participating-org.narrative: KAPIRI MPOSHI DISTRICT HEALTH MANAGEMENT TEAM
NATIONAL HIV AIDS STI TB COUNCIL

sector.narrative: Coordination support, Civil society support, Guideline development, Capacity development, M/E systems and Technical Support for HIV prevention, treatment and care
HIV service access and quality improvement through system strengthening at facility and community levels
HIV testing and counselling including EID, POC EID, PITC, ANC testing, Self testing, Retesting and Family based testing

Programme support for PMTCT including for triple elimination, viral load monitoring, retention in care, infant feeding, PreP among HIV-negative women and negative partners, family planning and partner testing
Treatment for PMTCT and infant ARV prophylaxis
